mythicalBeasts.name: Dragon
mythicalBeasts.brief_description: A large, serpentine or reptilian creature often associated with great power and destruction.

mythicalBeasts.name: Phoenix
mythicalBeasts.brief_description: A bird that cyclically regenerates or is reborn from its ashes.

mythicalBeasts.name: Kraken
mythicalBeasts.brief_description: A colossal sea monster often depicted as a giant octopus or squid.

mythicalBeasts.name: Minotaur
mythicalBeasts.brief_description: A creature with the body of a man and the head of a bull, often found in a labyrinth.

mythicalBeasts.name: Sphinx
mythicalBeasts.brief_description: A creature with the body of a lion, wings of a bird, and the face of a human.

mythicalBeasts.name: Cerberus
mythicalBeasts.brief_description: A multi-headed dog guarding the entrance to the Greek Underworld.

mythicalBeasts.name: Basilisk
mythicalBeasts.brief_description: A deadly serpent or dragon known for its ability to kill with a single glance.

mythicalBeasts.name: Griffin
mythicalBeasts.brief_description: A creature with the body of a lion and the head of an eagle.

mythicalBeasts.name: Kitsune
mythicalBeasts.brief_description: A fox spirit often associated with intelligence and trickery.

mythicalBeasts.name: Chimera
mythicalBeasts.brief_description: A monstrous creature with the body parts of various animals, often with a lion's head, goat body, and serpent tail.

mythicalBeasts.name: Yamata no Orochi
mythicalBeasts.brief_description: An enormous eight-headed and eight-tailed serpent from Japanese mythology.

mythicalBeasts.name: Roc
mythicalBeasts.brief_description: A legendary giant bird of prey, often said to be able to carry off large animals.

mythicalBeasts.name: Bunyip
mythicalBeasts.brief_description: An amphibious creature believed to inhabit swamps and waterholes in Australian Aboriginal mythology.

mythicalBeasts.name: Chupacabra
mythicalBeasts.brief_description: A legendary creature said to suck the blood of livestock, primarily goats and chickens, in Latin American folklore.

mythicalBeasts.name: Manticore
mythicalBeasts.brief_description: A mythical creature with a human head, a lion's body, and the tail of a scorpion.

mythicalBeasts.name: Troll
mythicalBeasts.brief_description: Large, often ugly creatures found in Scandinavian folklore known for their strength and resilience.

mythicalBeasts.name: Nian
mythicalBeasts.brief_description: A lion-like creature that terrorizes villages during the Chinese New Year and fears loud noises.

mythicalBeasts.name: Yeti
mythicalBeasts.brief_description: A mysterious ape-like creature said to inhabit the Himalayas, known for its elusiveness.

mythicalBeasts.name: Mokele-mbembe
mythicalBeasts.brief_description: A mythical creature often described as a living dinosaur said to inhabit the Congo River basin.

mythicalBeasts.name: Banshee
mythicalBeasts.brief_description: A female spirit known for her eerie wailing, believed to be an omen of death in Irish folklore.
